intro: Sulcorebutia arenacea var. candiae, commonly known as the Canary Island cactus or the candia cactus, is a member of the Cactaceae family native to the Canary Islands. It is a small, low-growing cactus with a compact, globular shape and typically features a green to bluish-green stem. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to arid environments, with succulent stems that store water and spines that provide protection. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable growing conditions.
